question.text:
Match the proteins with their appropriate properties.


 
  Protein   Property
(1) Collagen (i) Hormone
(2) Trypsin (ii) Enzyme
(3) Insulin (iii) Fight Infectious agent
(4) Receptor (iv) Enable glucose transport into cells
(5) GLUT-4 (v) Sensory reception (smell, taste hormone)
(6) Antibody (vi) Intercellular ground substance

solution.text: Collagen is the most abundant protein found in the animal body forming the matrix or ground substance of connective tissue that joins almost all parts and tissues of the body. Trypsin is the active form of digestive enzyme secreted by pancreas. Insulin is a peptide hormone helping in reducing blood glucose. Receptor is a molecule that receives the signal or assist in sensing stimuli. GLUT-4 is a transporter molecule found in the cell that helps glucose uptake in the cell. Antibody is a protein molecule produced by B lymphocyte to fight pathogens.
